oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Risk-Sensitive Control of Pure Jump Process on Countable Space with Near Monotone Cost
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMAR, KS
PAL, C
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Risk-sensitive control
Controlled Markov chain
Multiplicative dynamic programming principle
Harnack's inequality
Near monotone cost
MARKOV-PROCESSES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this article, we study risk-sensitive control problem with controlled continuous time pure jump process on a countable space as state dynamics. We prove multiplicative dynamic programming principle, elliptic and parabolic Harnack's inequalities. Using the multiplicative dynamic programing principle and the Harnack's inequalities, we prove the existence and a characterization of optimal risk-sensitive control under the near monotone condition.
